topics.title: Scalability
topics.note: The ability to handle growth. Vertical (buy bigger RAM) vs Horizontal (buy more machines).

topics.title: Availability
topics.note: Uptime. Measured in 9s (e.g., 99.999%). Does the system respond when I call it?

topics.title: Reliability
topics.note: Correctness. Does the system give me the *right* data every time without crashing?

topics.title: Fault Tolerance
topics.note: The ability to keep working even when a server crashes (Graceful Degradation).

topics.title: SPOF (Single Point of Failure)
topics.note: If this one thing breaks, everything stops. (e.g., One master DB with no slave).

topics.title: Latency vs Throughput
topics.note: Latency = Speed of a Ferrari (time to finish). Throughput = Capacity of a Highway (cars per hour).

topics.title: OSI Model
topics.note: 7 Layers. Focus on Layer 4 (Transport/TCP) and Layer 7 (Application/HTTP).

topics.title: TCP vs UDP
topics.note: TCP = Reliable/Slow (Email, Banking). UDP = Fast/Lossy (Gaming, Live Streaming).

topics.title: DNS
topics.note: The Phonebook of the internet. A Records, CNAME, and why DNS caching is vital.

topics.title: HTTP/HTTPS
topics.note: Verbs (GET, POST), Status Codes (200, 404, 500), and SSL/TLS Handshakes.

topics.title: WebSockets
topics.note: Persistent, bi-directional connections. The backbone of Chat Apps.

topics.title: REST API
topics.note: Stateless, standard HTTP verbs. The default for most web services.

topics.title: GraphQL
topics.note: Client asks for exactly what it needs. Solves Over-fetching.

topics.title: gRPC
topics.note: High performance internal communication using Protobufs.

topics.title: Idempotency
topics.note: Safe retries. Clicking 'Buy' twice shouldn't charge you twice.

topics.title: Rate Limiting
topics.note: Stopping abuse. 429 Too Many Requests.

topics.title: SQL (RDBMS)
topics.note: Structured, ACID compliant, uses Joins. (PostgreSQL, MySQL).

topics.title: NoSQL
topics.note: Flexible schema, specific scaling needs. (MongoDB, DynamoDB).

topics.title: Sharding
topics.note: Splitting a large database into smaller chunks based on a key.

topics.title: Replication
topics.note: Master-Slave architecture. Writes go to Master, Reads go to Slaves.

topics.title: CAP Theorem
topics.note: In a distributed system, you can only have 2 of 3: Consistency, Availability, Partition Tolerance.

topics.title: Load Balancing
topics.note: Distributing traffic. L4 (Transport) vs L7 (Application) balancers.

topics.title: Caching
topics.note: storing expensive data in RAM (Redis). Write-through vs Cache-aside.

topics.title: CDN
topics.note: Content Delivery Network. Serving images/video from a server near the user.

topics.title: Message Queues
topics.note: Decoupling services. Kafka (Streaming) vs RabbitMQ (Task processing).

topics.title: Pub/Sub
topics.note: Publish-Subscribe pattern. One event triggers many services.

topics.title: Design URL Shortener
topics.note: Focus: Unique IDs, Database heavy read ratio.

topics.title: Design Rate Limiter
topics.note: Focus: Algorithms, Counter storage (Redis).

topics.title: Design Instagram/Feed
topics.note: Focus: Fan-out on Write vs Fan-out on Read.

topics.title: Design WhatsApp
topics.note: Focus: Real-time (WebSockets), Offline messages.

topics.title: Design Uber
topics.note: Focus: Geospatial queries (QuadTrees), Matching.

topics.title: Design Google Drive
topics.note: Focus: File Chunking, Synchronization.
